content.text:
# List of wars involving Finland

This is a list of wars involving Finland since its declaration of independence on 6 December 1917.
List

|-

! rowspan="2" width=150px| Party 1
! rowspan="2" width=150px| Party 2

! rowspan="2"| Finnish losses(dead or missing)

|style="background:#efefef"| Continuation War(1941–1944)Part of the Eastern Front of World War II
|style="background:#efefef"| Naval support:|group="lower-alpha"}}
|style="background:#efefef"| Air support: Before that, the British conducted a carrier raid at Petsamo on 31 July 1941, and commenced Operation Benedict to support air raids in the Murmansk area and train Soviet crews for roughly a month from September to October in 1941}}}}
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
* Moscow Armistice
* Start of the Lapland War
* Petsamo ceded to the USSR
* Porkkala Peninsula leased to the USSR for 50 years|group="lower-alpha"}}
* Hanko retaken by Finland
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| }}
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Lapland War(1944–1945)Part of the Second World War
|style="background:#efefef"|  FinlandMinor air support: Soviet Union Jowett and Snodgrass write about the war as a conflict between German and Finnish troops, but include the offensive in the war's timeline. Zabecki begins by mentioning that Lapland extends to Norway and the Soviet Union. He states that the "Finnish War of Lapland" started between Finland and Germany, but links the Soviet offensive to it. Jaques writes of the offensive as a part of the war in a dictionary of battles.}}
|style="background:#efefef"|  Germany
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*German retreat from Finnish territory
|style="background:#efefef"|
